item.description:
Brian Vanden Brink Monday January 14th, 2013, 7:30–9:30pm

Brian Vanden Brink was born in Omaha, Nebraska in 1951. He moved to Rockport, Maine in 1978, and began photographing architecture professionally in 1979. He works with architects from all over the United States and his work has been widely featured in magazines and books about architecture. He has produced 6 books of his own work, among them RUIN: Photographs of a Vanishing America, which is a study of abandoned architecture from across the U.S. The book has won 2 awards, Critic’s Choice as best book in New England 2009 from the New England Journal of Aesthetic research and from Photo District News Magazine, the book was selected as one of the best photo books of 2010 and one of “PDN’S

Players, Innovators who made the year in photography”. Brian’s newest book ICONIC: Perspectives on the Man-Made World was released in September 2012. He lives in Camden, Maine with Kathleen, his wife of 37 years. Visit his website at www.brianvandenbrink.com.

“I’m interested in photographing the built environment and its relationship to the landscape. I’m fascinated by abandoned architecture, or what we leave behind in our development and growth. I love to photograph how and where we live, seeing in our architecture an expression of what we value and what is important to us. I am attracted to photographing design, whether it is represented by a hot dog stand, a Romanesque cathedral or a private residence. My primary tool is the light, which defines space and adds emotion. And, oh yes, a camera. Preferably a view camera...” - Brian Vanden Brink.

LOCATION
Calumet Boston
150 First Street,
Cambridge, MA 02142

Registration: 6:30–7:30pm
Program: 7:30–9:30pm

Cost: CIPNE Members, Free; Guests, $35; Full-time Students*, $5.

*Full-time students will be required to present their photo-IDs at registration.

Pre-registration is required for this program.

https://events.r20.constantcontact.com/register/eventReg?oeidk=a07e6stbu0646fa2a61&oseq=

(Non-members may pay by PayPal)
Please note: on-line registration closes January 11th.

group.name: Worcester Alliance of Photographers - AKA: WAP

item.name: Architectural Photography: A discussion with Brian Vanden Brink
